best_candidate.signature:ClassificationInput:text:desc: The text snippet whose overall sentiment must be classified into exactly one of {positive, negative, neutral}. Inputs may be short, fragmentary, and include mixed aspects, negations, concessive/contrastive markers, faint-praise terms (e.g., “okay”, “decent”, “edible”), emojis/emoticons, or idioms. Interpret idioms pragmatically (e.g., “it is what it is” → negative; “could be worse” → mildly positive; “can’t complain” → neutral). Treat hedged/softened critiques and unmet-expectation constructions (e.g., “could/should be better,” “needs work,” “room for improvement,” “not ideal”) as negative by default. In mixed-aspect statements, prioritize core attributes (quality/performance/reliability/safety/overall experience) over secondary ones (price, packaging, shipping speed, aesthetics); do not let a weak consolation or a secondary positive overturn a strong/core negative. Note that “mediocre/so-so/subpar” are negative cues, while “okay/fine/decent” are neutral to very weak positive. Output only a JSON object with a single "category" field from {"positive","negative","neutral"}.
